qas.question: During what years did Frédéric visit the Warsaw Lyceum for lessons?
Who was Frédéric a student of involving music theory starting in 1826?
What was the name of the mechanical organ Frédéric performed on during 1825?
Which tsar did Frédéric perform for due to his success in previous concerts?
On what date was Frédéric's first performance that earned international esteem?
Who taught Chopin to play the organ?
Chopin had three years of lessons with whom?
What instrument did Chopin play in front of Tsar Alexander I?
What gift did Tsar Alexander I give to Chopin?
What was the first of Chopin's works to gain international renown?
Who gave Chopin instruction on how to play the organ?
What was the name of the teacher of Chopin's three year course that began in the fall of 1826?
What is th ename of the mechanical organ Chopin played in 1825?
What did Tsar Alexander I give to Chopin?
What is the title of his first commercially successful work?

context: From September <a0_0>1823 to 1826<a0_0/> Chopin attended the Warsaw Lyceum, where he received organ lessons from the Czech musician <a5_0><a10_0>Wilhelm Würfel<a10_0/><a5_0/> during his first year. In the autumn of 1826 he began a three-year course under the Silesian composer <a1_0><a6_0><a11_0>Józef Elsner<a11_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/> at the Warsaw Conservatory, studying music theory, figured bass and composition.[n 3] Throughout this period he continued to compose and to give recitals in concerts and salons in Warsaw. He was engaged by the inventors of a mechanical organ, the "<a2_0><a7_0><a12_0>eolomelodicon<a12_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>", and on this instrument in May 1825 he performed his own improvisation and part of a concerto by Moscheles. The success of this concert led to an invitation to give a similar recital on the instrument before Tsar <a3_0>Alexander I<a3_0/>, who was visiting Warsaw; the Tsar presented him with <a13_0>a <a8_0>diamond ring<a8_0/>.<a13_0/> At a subsequent eolomelodicon concert on <a4_0>10 June 1825<a4_0/>, Chopin performed his <a9_0><a14_0>Rondo Op. 1<a9_0/>.<a14_0/> This was the first of his works to be commercially published and earned him his first mention in the foreign press, when the Leipzig Allgemeine Musikalische Zeitung praised his "wealth of musical ideas".
